quotes.quote: Privacy is necessary for an open society in the electronic age.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.quote: We must defend our own privacy if we expect to have any.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.quote: Cryptography is the ultimate form of non-violent direct action.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.quote: The computer can be used as a tool to liberate and protect people, rather than to control them.
quotes.author: Hal Finney

quotes.quote: If privacy is outlawed, only outlaws will have privacy.
quotes.author: Phil Zimmermann

quotes.quote: The government should not be able to collect all your private data just because it wants to do so.
quotes.author: Bruce Schneier

quotes.quote: With e-currency based on cryptographic proof, without the need to trust a third-party middleman, money can be secure and transactions effortless.
quotes.author: Satoshi Nakamoto

quotes.quote: We cannot expect governments, corporations, or other large, faceless organizations to grant us privacy out of their beneficence.
quotes.author: Eric Hughes

quotes.quote: Cryptography shifts the balance of power from those with a monopoly on violence to those who comprehend mathematics and security design.
quotes.author: Jacob Appelbaum

quotes.quote: The right to speak PGP is the right to speak Navajo. The right to speak with encryption is the right to speak at all.
quotes.author: Gary Kasparov

quotes.quote: No amount of violence can solve a math problem.
quotes.author: Jacob Appelbaum

quotes.quote: A lot of people who are 'opposed' to the anonymous internet, are really opposed to uncensored speech.
quotes.author: Caleb Chen

quotes.quote: Encryption works. Properly implemented strong crypto systems are one of the few things that you can rely on.
quotes.author: Edward Snowden

quotes.quote: Governments of the Industrial World, you weary giants of flesh and steel, I come from Cyberspace, the new home of Mind.
quotes.author: John Perry Barlow

quotes.quote: The Internet interprets censorship as damage and routes around it.
quotes.author: John Gilmore
